segment.source: About the Deployment Tab
segment.target: About the Deployment Tab

segment.source: About the Deployment Tab
segment.target: About the Deployment Tab

segment.source: About the Deployment Tab
segment.target: About the Deployment Tab

segment.source: Use the Deployment tab in the Application Virtualization Sequencer Console to change the information for an application you are about to sequence.
segment.target: Use the Deployment tab in the Application Virtualization Sequencer Console to change the information for an application you are about to sequence.

segment.source: This tab contains the following elements.
segment.target: This tab contains the following elements.

segment.source: Server URL
segment.target: Server URL

segment.source: Use the Server URL controls to specify the virtual application server configuration settings.
segment.target: Use the Server URL controls to specify the virtual application server configuration settings.

segment.source: Control
segment.target: Control

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Protocol
segment.target: Protocol

segment.source: Enables you to select the protocol that will stream the sequenced application package from a virtual application server to an Application Virtualization Desktop Client.
segment.target: Enables you to select the protocol that will stream the sequenced application package from a virtual application server to an Application Virtualization Desktop Client.

segment.source: The following protocols are available:
segment.target: The following protocols are available:

segment.source: RTSP—The default, it specifies that the Real-Time Streaming Protocol controls the exchange of virtualization-enabled applications.
segment.target: RTSP—The default, it specifies that the Real-Time Streaming Protocol controls the exchange of virtualization-enabled applications.

segment.source: RTSPS—Specifies that the Real-Time Streaming Protocol with Transport Layer Security controls the exchange of a sequenced application package.
segment.target: RTSPS—Specifies that the Real-Time Streaming Protocol with Transport Layer Security controls the exchange of a sequenced application package.

segment.source: File—Specifies that the sequenced application will be streamed from a file share.
segment.target: File—Specifies that the sequenced application will be streamed from a file share.

segment.source: HTTPS—Specifies that Secure Hypertext Transport Protocol controls the exchange of a package.
segment.target: HTTPS—Specifies that Secure Hypertext Transport Protocol controls the exchange of a package.

segment.source: Hostname
segment.target: Hostname

segment.source: Enables you to select the virtual application server or the load balancer in front of a group of virtual application servers that will stream the software package to an Application Virtualization Desktop Client.
segment.target: Enables you to select the virtual application server or the load balancer in front of a group of virtual application servers that will stream the software package to an Application Virtualization Desktop Client.

segment.source: You must complete this item to create a sequenced application package, but you can change from the default %SFT_SOFTGRIDSERVER% environment variable to the actual hostname or IP address of a virtual application server.
segment.target: You must complete this item to create a sequenced application package, but you can change from the default %SFT_SOFTGRIDSERVER% environment variable to the actual hostname or IP address of a virtual application server.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If you choose not to specify a static hostname or IP address, on each Application Virtualization Desktop Client you must set up an environment variable called SFT_SOFTGRIDSERVER.
segment.target: If you choose not to specify a static hostname or IP address, on each Application Virtualization Desktop Client you must set up an environment variable called SFT_SOFTGRIDSERVER.

segment.source: Its value must be the hostname or IP address of the virtual application server or load balancer that is this client's source of applications.
segment.target: Its value must be the hostname or IP address of the virtual application server or load balancer that is this client's source of applications.

segment.source: You should make this environment variable a system variable rather than a user variable.
segment.target: You should make this environment variable a system variable rather than a user variable.

segment.source: Any Application Virtualization Desktop Client session that is running on this computer during your assignment of this variable must be closed and then opened so that the resumed session will be aware of its new application source.
segment.target: Any Application Virtualization Desktop Client session that is running on this computer during your assignment of this variable must be closed and then opened so that the resumed session will be aware of its new application source.

segment.source: Port
segment.target: Port

segment.source: Enables you to specify the port on which the virtual application server or the load balancer will listen for an Application Virtualization Desktop Client's request for the package.
segment.target: Enables you to specify the port on which the virtual application server or the load balancer will listen for an Application Virtualization Desktop Client's request for the package.

segment.source: This information is required to create a package, but you can change it.
segment.target: This information is required to create a package, but you can change it.

segment.source: The default port is 554.
segment.target: The default port is 554.

segment.source: Path
segment.target: Path

segment.source: Enables you to specify the relative path on the virtual application server where the software package is stored and from which it will be streamed.
segment.target: Enables you to specify the relative path on the virtual application server where the software package is stored and from which it will be streamed.

segment.source: This information is required to create a package if the SFT file will be stored in a subdirectory of CONTENT; otherwise, this information is not required.
segment.target: This information is required to create a package if the SFT file will be stored in a subdirectory of CONTENT; otherwise, this information is not required.

segment.source: Operating Systems
segment.target: Operating Systems

segment.source: Use the Operating Systems controls to specify the application's operating system requirements.
segment.target: Use the Operating Systems controls to specify the application's operating system requirements.

segment.source: If an Application Virtualization Desktop Client cannot support any of the selected operating systems, the application will not start.
segment.target: If an Application Virtualization Desktop Client cannot support any of the selected operating systems, the application will not start.

segment.source: Controls
segment.target: Controls

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Available Operating Systems
segment.target: Available Operating Systems

segment.source: Displays a list of operating systems that can support the applications in the package.
segment.target: Displays a list of operating systems that can support the applications in the package.

segment.source: Selected Operating Systems
segment.target: Selected Operating Systems

segment.source: Displays a list of selected operating systems that support the applications in the package.
segment.target: Displays a list of selected operating systems that support the applications in the package.

segment.source: Output Options
segment.target: Output Options

segment.source: Use the Output Options controls to specify the output options for the application to be installed.
segment.target: Use the Output Options controls to specify the output options for the application to be installed.

segment.source: Control
segment.target: Control

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Compression Algorithm
segment.target: Compression Algorithm

segment.source: Use to select the method for compressing the SFT file for streaming across a network.
segment.target: Use to select the method for compressing the SFT file for streaming across a network.

segment.source: Select one of the following compression methods:
segment.target: Select one of the following compression methods:

segment.source: Compressed—Specifies that the SFT file be compressed in the ZLIB format.
segment.target: Compressed—Specifies that the SFT file be compressed in the ZLIB format.

segment.source: Not Compressed—The default; specifies that the SFT file not be compressed.
segment.target: Not Compressed—The default; specifies that the SFT file not be compressed.

segment.source: Enforce Security Descriptors
segment.target: Enforce Security Descriptors

segment.source: Select to enforce security descriptors of the applications in the package after it is deployed to the client.
segment.target: Select to enforce security descriptors of the applications in the package after it is deployed to the client.

segment.source: Generate Microsoft Windows Installer (MSI) Package
segment.target: Generate Microsoft Windows Installer (MSI) Package

segment.source: Select to install or deploy a sequenced application package with the Windows Installer.
segment.target: Select to install or deploy a sequenced application package with the Windows Installer.

segment.source: If you have made any changes using the sequencer the changes will not be included with the Windows Installer file.
segment.target: If you have made any changes using the sequencer the changes will not be included with the Windows Installer file.

segment.source: The Windows Installer file will always be created using the .sft file saved on the hard disk.
segment.target: The Windows Installer file will always be created using the .sft file saved on the hard disk.

segment.source: Related topics
segment.target: Related topics

segment.target: How to Change Deployment Properties
